info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 5 at 1:19AM CDT until July 5 at 7:52PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Llano River at Llano affecting Llano County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Llano River at Llano.
* WHEN...Until this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding threatens docks and boats in the flood plain downstream in Kingsland. Secondary roads and bridges will be flooded and dangerous to motorists. Flow exceeds the USGS 1:2 year flood level.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 AM CDT Saturday was 26.6 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and is now falliing. It will continue to fall below flood stage this morning to 7.2 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground.
Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening by 730 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING
